‚úçÔ∏è Lesson 7: Modifying Data (INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE)

‚è±Ô∏è Estimated time: 20 minutes | Difficulty: Intermediate

Handle with Care

These commands directly modify the data in your database. Always double-check your conditions (especially for UPDATE and DELETE) to avoid accidental data loss!

INSERT ‚Äî Add New Data

-- Insert one row
INSERT INTO users (name, email, age)
VALUES ('Alice', 'alice@email.com', 25);

-- Insert multiple rows
INSERT INTO users (name, email, age) VALUES
  ('Bob', 'bob@email.com', 30),
  ('Charlie', 'charlie@mail.io', 22),
  ('Diana', 'diana@test.com', 28);

UPDATE ‚Äî Modify Existing Data

-- Update specific row
UPDATE users SET age = 26 WHERE name = 'Alice';

-- Update multiple columns
UPDATE users SET email = 'new@email.com', age = 31
WHERE id = 2;

-- ‚ö†Ô∏è Without WHERE, updates ALL rows!
UPDATE users SET age = 0;  -- DANGER! Changes everyone!

DELETE ‚Äî Remove Data

-- Delete specific row
DELETE FROM users WHERE id = 3;

-- Delete with condition
DELETE FROM users WHERE age < 18;

-- ‚ö†Ô∏è Without WHERE, deletes ALL rows!
DELETE FROM users;  -- DANGER! Removes everything!

-- TRUNCATE: faster way to delete all rows
TRUNCATE TABLE users;

‚ö†Ô∏è Safety Tips

  • üîí Always use WHERE with UPDATE and DELETE
  • üß™ Test with SELECT first: SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = 3;
  • üíæ Backup before bulk operations
  • üîÑ Use transactions for safe changes

‚úÖ Quick Quiz

‚ùì What happens if you run DELETE without WHERE?

‚ùì How to add multiple rows at once?

‚ùì What should you do before a bulk DELETE?
